Infectum and Infectum-wa.turoyo: ašər mədli l-i=mandruniye, k-obaʕno mandanno əšmo i=goro 260; 75/142;
translations: ach, ich habe die Dachwalze genommen und wollte ein bisschen das Dach walzen

Infectum and Infectum-wa.turoyo: 42. Ánnaqqa áydarbo ktowe? Azzə́n li+qamaytayḏe, mxamalle manduriye (manduriye, kefo, ha hawxa, ha hawxa ḥləmto, ha hawxa mandrí<w>ayna meqəm ann+igore. Naqqa dlatwa čimanto mandríwayna ann+igore eba).
translations: Now then, how does it go? They went to meet him, they dressed up a roller (a roller, a stone, like so, so thick, formerly we used to flatten roofs this way. When there was no cement we used to flatten roofs with it). – Story of Joseph
